sprint_goal: Establish the foundational secure transformation engine and the data model for script management, enabling parallel API and UI development.
epic_coverage: Core Transformation Engine, System Security, Control Panel UI (DB)
key_deliverables: Secure Jint wrapper service; DB schema for scripts; Encryption at rest for scripts.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a script executing via a unit test; Show encrypted data in the database; Demonstrate RBAC on a test API endpoint.
success_criteria: Core Jint engine is sandboxed and passes security review; Database model is finalized and migrated; API contract for script CRUD can be defined for Sprint 2.
risk_factors: Jint sandboxing proves more complex than estimated; DPAPI key management issues.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize security-critical tasks; Document key management procedures early.
burndown_target: Complete core engine tasks by day 5 to de-risk the sprint.

sprint_goal: Deliver the complete CRUD interface for creating, editing, and managing transformation scripts, including a rich code editor and robust error handling.
epic_coverage: Control Panel UI and API, Core Transformation Engine
key_deliverables: Full CRUD API for scripts; Script list and edit UI; Integrated Monaco editor.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate creating a new script; Demonstrate editing a script with syntax highlighting and validation; Demonstrate deleting a script.
success_criteria: An administrator can manage the full lifecycle of a transformation script via the UI; Monaco editor integration is stable.
risk_factors: Monaco editor integration complexity and bundle size impact.
mitigation_strategies: Use dynamic imports for Monaco editor; Define API contract on day 1 to enable parallel development.
burndown_target: API complete by day 4; UI integration complete by day 8.

sprint_goal: Implement the interactive script preview feature for rapid development and establish the complete, immutable audit trail for all script management and security violations.
epic_coverage: Control Panel UI and API, System Security and Auditing
key_deliverables: Script preview API with timeout; 3-pane resizable preview UI; Audit logging to MongoDB for CRUD operations.
demo_objectives: Preview a script with sample JSON; Preview a script with live connector data; Show a timeout error; View audit logs in MongoDB after creating a script.
success_criteria: The preview feature is fully functional and stable; All required actions are being captured in the audit log in the correct format.
risk_factors: Live data preview from connectors may be slow; Transactional integrity with audit logging.
mitigation_strategies: Ensure connectors support fetching limited samples; Use a post-commit event publishing model for auditing.

sprint_goal: Enhance script management with version history, comparison, and revert capabilities, while implementing critical performance benchmarks and stability guardrails.
epic_coverage: Control Panel UI and API, Core Transformation Engine
key_deliverables: Script version history and revert API/UI; Script diff view; Automated performance benchmark test; Max dataset size limit.
demo_objectives: Show version history for a script; Compare two versions visually; Revert a script to a previous version; Demonstrate the performance benchmark test running in CI.
success_criteria: Administrators can safely manage script versions; The system has automated checks for performance regressions and resource abuse.
risk_factors: Performance benchmark test may be flaky depending on CI runner performance; Diff viewer integration complexity.
mitigation_strategies: Establish a performance baseline for the CI runner; Use Monaco Diff Editor to leverage existing component expertise.
integration_windows: QA validation of performance test by day 8.
burndown_target: Backend APIs for versioning complete by day 4.

sprint_goal: Achieve full operational readiness by implementing Prometheus monitoring, feature flagging, migration paths, comprehensive documentation, and all remaining 'Should Have'/'Could Have' features.
epic_coverage: Operational Readiness, Core Engine, Control Panel UI
key_deliverables: Feature flag implementation; Prometheus metrics endpoint; JSON Schema validation; Comprehensive documentation.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate disabling the feature with the flag; Show custom metrics in a Prometheus instance; Demonstrate a report job failing due to schema validation; Review completed documentation set.
success_criteria: The feature is production-ready, monitorable, well-documented, and can be safely deployed.
risk_factors: Documentation effort is often underestimated; Migration script requires access to realistic legacy data.
mitigation_strategies: Start documentation early in the sprint; Obtain legacy data sample before starting migration script work.
integration_windows: Final QA and UAT throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: All development tasks complete by day 7 to allow for extensive documentation review and final testing.
